intro: Ancistrocladus congolensis, commonly known as the African poisonwood, is a small evergreen tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain toxic seeds, which are avoided by most animals. Its roots and leaves contain various toxic compounds, making it a plant of both ecological and medicinal interest. Despite its toxicity, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties.
